questions.question: What will happen if an equal force is applied to an object from both sides?
choices: It will move to the right.
It will move to the left.
questions.correctAnswer: It won’t move.
questions.subject: stem

questions.question: What shape should a building be for it to be the strongest?
choices: A triangle – like the Eiffel Tower
A circular shape – like a dome.
questions.correctAnswer: A triangle – like the Eiffel Tower
questions.subject: stem

questions.question: There are two roads to the top of a mountain. One is less steep but longer and one is very steep but shorter. Which would be easier to climb?
choices: The less steep but longer one.
The more steep but shorter one.
questions.correctAnswer: The less steep but longer one.
questions.subject: stem

questions.question: I am home, and I have run out of clean water to drink. I only have tap water. How can I make it drinkable?
choices: I’ll just have to wait for someone to give me water.
I am really thirsty, if I drink it just once, it’s okay.
I can put it in the micro-wave and make it really, really hot. This will kill all the germs.
I’ll just strain the water with a tea-strainer and then it’ll be clean.
questions.correctAnswer: I can put it in the micro-wave and make it really, really hot. This will kill all the germs.
questions.subject: stem

questions.question: How many folds will you need to make a computer paper into a triangle?
questions.correctAnswer: Two folds.
questions.subject: stem

questions.correctAnswer: All of these.

questions.question: I am an astronaut in space and I want to watch TV which is nailed to the ground. However, I keep floating around! What can I do to stay on the ground?
choices: I can put rocks in my pocket, so the weight makes me not float.
I can put glue on my pants so I stick to the ground.
I hold onto the TV, so I don’t _oat.
questions.correctAnswer: I can put rocks in my pocket, so the weight makes me not float.
questions.subject: stem

questions.question: Which of these is not a simple machine?
questions.correctAnswer: A Computer

questions.question: Which is the odd one out?
questions.correctAnswer: Rabbit - Shed

questions.correctAnswer: Both of these

questions.correctAnswer: Rahul

questions.question: A pack of cards has 52 cards. 26 cards are red, and 26 cards are black. If you had to pick only one card, what are the chances that it will be black?
choices: There’s a very small chance it will be back.
There’s an equal chance it will be black or red.
questions.correctAnswer: There’s an equal chance it will be black or red.

questions.question: Refer to the given chart - To not get corona you need to:
questions.correctAnswer: Do all three.

questions.question: What is the meaning of ‘critiquing’?
choices: To judge if something is good or bad – a toy or a movie.
To talk about all the things I like about something – a toy or a movie.
To talk about all the things I don’t like about something – a toy or a movie.
questions.correctAnswer: To judge if something is good or bad – a toy or a movie.
questions.subject: Leadership Communication

questions.question: A critique saw a movie, and he told everyone – “It’s a really rubbish movie. No one should watch it!” Do you think this is a good review? Why or why not?
choices: This isn’t a good review – he needs to tell me why he thinks it’s bad.
This is a good review– he gave his opinion.
This isn’t a good review – it’s not okay that he doesn’t like it.
questions.correctAnswer: This isn’t a good review – he needs to tell me why he thinks it’s bad.
questions.subject: Leadership Communication

questions.question: If you had to create a story book, what are all the things you would have to think about?
choices: The hero and villain of my book.
The place where it is all happening.
questions.correctAnswer: All of these.
questions.subject: Leadership Communication

questions.question: What is a debate?
choices: Talking about something where people have different opinions than us.
When we stop talking to people who have different opinions than us.
questions.correctAnswer: Talking about something where people have different opinions than us.
questions.subject: Leadership Communication

questions.question: What is not the best use of a blog?
choices: To write down questions and answers from my school textbook.
I don’t know what a blog is.
questions.correctAnswer: ) To write down questions and answers from my school textbook.
questions.subject: Leadership Communication

questions.question: What does it mean to be ‘persuasive’?
choices: To get someone to listen to me.
questions.correctAnswer: To get someone to listen to me.
questions.subject: Leadership Communication

questions.question: If you had to convince your teacher to be a monitor, what would you tell her?
choices: I would tell her, “Please make me a monitor! ”.
I would tell her, “I will feel really bad if you don’t make me one.”
I would tell her, “I will not listen to you anymore if you don’t make me one.”
I would tell her, “If I got a chance to be one, I’ll ensure I’ll be the best monitor ever.”
questions.correctAnswer: I would tell her, “If I got a chance to be one, I’ll ensure I’ll be the best monitor ever.”
questions.subject: Leadership Communication

questions.question: What will I have to do if I want to be a you-tuber?
choices: I record any video I want.
I think about a topic I want to speak about, then record a video.
I think about a topic, record a video and then put it on YouTube.
I don’t know who a YouTuber is!
questions.correctAnswer: I think about a topic, record a video and then put it on YouTube.
questions.subject: Leadership Communication
